ai-iti101:0.3_0: The Chapter on the Holy Offering of the Teaching
ai-iti101:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti101:2.1_0: “Mendicants, these four trifles are easy to find and are blameless.
ai-iti101:2.4_0: Pcollections, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-iti101:2.5_0: Now at the root of a tree, soft and easy to find.
ai-iti101:2.7_0: These four trifles are easy to find and are blameless.
ai-iti101:2.8_0: When a mendicant is content with trifles that are easy to find, they have one of the factors of the ascetic life, I say.”
ai-iti101:4.1_0: Those who are full of joy
ai-iti101:4.3_0: They’re mastered by one who trains,
ai-iti101:5.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
